_accessibilityInstructions.touch: Usage instructions. Use swipe left for next. Use swipe right for previous. Use a double tab to select. Use a two finger slide up to go to the top of the page.
_accessibilityInstructions.notouch: Usage instructions. Use tab for next. Use shift tab for previous. Use enter to select. Use escape to go to the top of the page.
_accessibilityInstructions.ipad: Usage instructions for touchscreens. Use swipe left for next. Use swipe right for previous. Use a double tab to select. Use a two finger slide up to go to the top of the page. Usage instructions for keyboard access. Use left for next. Use right for previous. Use up and down together to select.

body:
OpenActive is an ambitious, community-led initiative for change across the sport and physical activity sector, which promotes the use of opportunity data to help people get active.

Our goal is to make data on what, where and when physical activity sessions happen, openly available. This “opportunity data” includes details of a yoga class (“how much will it cost?”) through to badminton court availability (“where and when is a court available?”). 

This interactive tutorial shows you how to create "opportunity data" that conforms to the community developed opportunity modelling specification.

For publishers and activity providers this tutorial will help get your data out there!

For users this tutorial will help you understand what sort of data you can use in your applications.

 

Each lesson should between 10-20 minutes to complete and it is highly recommended you follow the lessons in order.

 


Click on lesson 1 to get started creating your opportunity data!
title: Open Active -  Creating opportunity data

_trackingHub.saveBody:
Please enter your email address in the box below. You will receive an email linking to your unique profile so you can save your progress, earn rewards and resume your learning on any device.

Data regarding progress is stored by the Open Data Institute (ODI) Learning Record System (LRS) to (1) allow you to resume your learning and (2) to be used by the ODI produce a series of learning analytics. For more details please see the ODI privacy policy.
